CVE-2024-29829
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-05-31T18:31:23

3 posts

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an authenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

adulau at 2024-05-24T04:36:26.278Z ##

KB Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) May 2024

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

CVE-2024-29822
CVE-2024-29823
CVE-2024-29824
CVE-2024-29825
CVE-2024-29826
CVE-2024-29827

CVE-2024-29828

CVE-2024-29829

CVE-2024-29830

CVE-2024-29846

The good news, it's documented.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Security-Advisory-EPM-May-2024?language=en_US

KB Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) May 2024

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

CVE-2024-29822
CVE-2024-29823

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T17:25:34.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29825 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29826 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-22058
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-31T18:31:16

4 posts

A buffer overflow allows a low privilege user on the local machine that has the EPM Agent installed to execute arbitrary code with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 and older.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T16:26:49.587Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: CVE-2024-22058 Privilege Escalation for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
CVE-2024-22058 (7.8 high) buffer overflow to arbitrary code execution with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 SU5 and older. EPM 2022 and later are not impacted. The vulnerability affects legacy Remote Control, which is not included in EPM 2022 forward.

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

#CVE_2024_22058 #Ivanti #EPM #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T16:26:49.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: CVE-2024-22058 Privilege Escalation for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
CVE-2024-22058 (7.8 high) buffer overflow to arbitrary code execution with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 SU5 and older. EPM 2022 and later are not impacted. The vulnerability affects legacy Remote Control, which is not included in EPM 2022 forward.

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

##

CVE-2024-36470
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-31T14:15:10.607000

6 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.7, 2022.10.6, 2023.05.6, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.034Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.000Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.034Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.000Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

##

CVE-2024-5496(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-31T00:30:45

2 posts

Use after free in Media Session in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.141 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T21:43:22.897Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
11 security fixes, 7 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-5493 (high severity) Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC
  • CVE-2024-5494 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5495 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5496 (high severity) Use after free in Media Session
  • CVE-2024-5497 (high severity) Out of bounds memory access in Keyboard Inputs
  • CVE-2024-5498 (high severity) Use after free in Presentation API
  • CVE-2024-5499 (high severity) Out of bounds write in Streams API

No mention of exploitation (no zero day thank goodness).

Edit: Since Chromium was updated, here are Vivaldi and Edge release notes.

#PatchTuesday #Google #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T21:43:22.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-5514
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-30T13:15:41.297000

2 posts

MinMax CMS from MinMax Digital Technology contains a hidden administrator account with a fixed password that cannot be removed or disabled from the management interface. Remote attackers who obtain this account can bypass IP access control restrictions and log in to the backend system without being recorded in the system logs.

sbeyer@ioc.exchange at 2024-05-30T09:39:04.000Z ##

It is 2024 and some vendors still think this is a good idea:

(...) contains a HIDDEN ADMINISTRATOR ACCOUNT with a FIXED PASSWORD that CANNOT BE REMOVED OR DISABLED from the management interface. Remote attackers who obtain this account can BYPASS IP ACCESS CONTROL RESTRICTIONS and log in to the backend system WITHOUT BEING RECORDED in the system logs.

https://cve.threatint.com/CVE/CVE-2024-5514

#cybersecurity #cve #vulnerability #failure

##
sbeyer at 2024-05-30T09:39:04.430Z ##

It is 2024 and some vendors still think this is a good idea:

(...) contains a HIDDEN ADMINISTRATOR ACCOUNT with a FIXED PASSWORD that CANNOT BE REMOVED OR DISABLED from the management interface. Remote attackers who obtain this account can BYPASS IP ACCESS CONTROL RESTRICTIONS and log in to the backend system WITHOUT BEING RECORDED in the system logs.

https://cve.threatint.com/CVE/CVE-2024-5514

#cybersecurity #cve #vulnerability #failure

##

CVE-2024-5035
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-29T05:16:08.793000

4 posts

The affected device expose a network service called "rftest" that is vulnerable to unauthenticated command injection on ports TCP/8888, TCP/8889, and TCP/8890. By successfully exploiting this flaw, remote unauthenticated attacker can gain arbitrary command execution on the device with elevated privileges.This issue affects Archer C4500X: through 1_1.1.6.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-28T07:40:02.000Z ##

TP-Link Resolves High-Stakes Vulnerability in Archer C5400X Gaming Router https://thecyberexpress.com/tp-link-archer-c5400x-vulnerability/ #ArcherC5400Xvulnerability #remotecommandexecution #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #gamingrouter #CVE20245035

##
threatcodex at 2024-05-28T16:50:58.159Z ##

Security Advisory: Remote Command Execution on TP-Link Archer C5400X
#CVE_2024_5035
https://onekey.com/blog/security-advisory-remote-command-execution-on-tp-link-archer-c5400x/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-28T10:51:59.001Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5035, carries a CVSS score of 10.0. It impacts all versions of the router firmware including and prior to 1_1.1.6. It has been patched in version 1_1.1.7 released on May 24, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/tp-link-gaming-router-vulnerability.html

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T10:51:59.000Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5035, carries a CVSS score of 10.0. It impacts all versions of the router firmware including and prior to 1_1.1.6. It has been patched in version 1_1.1.7 released on May 24, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/tp-link-gaming-router-vulnerability.html

##

CVE-2024-5274
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.37%

updated 2024-05-29T01:00:04.140000

30 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.112 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T15:08:39.792Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds the Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-5274 (see parent toot above for information) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CVE_2024_5274 #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.127Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-5274 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. Reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on 2024-05-20

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_5274 #chrome #google

  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.

AAKL at 2024-05-28T15:33:17.743Z ##

#CISA entries today:

- CVE-2024-5274 KEV catalogue entry: #Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5274

- One Industrial Control Systems Advisory: Campbell Scientific CSI Web Server https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/05/28/cisa-releases-one-industrial-control-systems-advisory @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T04:45:58.614Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-5274 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 125.0.2535.67), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild. For more information, see the Security Update Guide

The issue is that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) didn’t create (or make live) the CVE-2024-5274 page at the time of publishing this message on 24 May 2024. cc: @ruario

##
beardedtechguy@allthingstech.social at 2024-05-24T16:54:08.000Z ##

This update includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

Minor update (7) for Vivaldi Desktop Browser 6.7 https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/

#Vivaldi #Browser

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:23:28.780Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/2024/05/opera-110-0-5130-39-stable-update/

Note: Opera referred to CVE-2024-5274 as a 0-day

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T14:40:09.913Z ##

@avoidthehack Vivaldi Desktop Browser, a Chromium-based web browser, version 6.7 "includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild." https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/
cc: @ruario

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-24T14:26:13.646Z ##

#Google fixes eighth actively exploited #Chrome zero-day this year

Another day, another 0 day in Chrome. It is another type confusion vulnerability in V8 (Chromium’s JavaScript engine). Evidence of active exploitation in the wild.

Tracked as CVE-2024-5274.

Affects #Chromium based web #browsers (not just Chrome), so maintained forks should be rolling updates ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-eighth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-this-year/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-24T13:16:13.857Z ##

Assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-5274, the vulnerability relates to a type confusion bug in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine. It was reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on May 20, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/google-detects-4th-chrome-zero-day-in.html

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T08:20:05.000Z ##

Google fixes yet another Chrome zero-day exploited in the wild (CVE-2024-5274) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/24/cve-2024-5274/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Vivaldi #Chrome #0-day #News #CVE

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-24T05:01:42.000Z ##

##

CVE-2018-5158
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.95%

updated 2024-05-28T20:43:54

1 posts

The PDF viewer does not sufficiently sanitize PostScript calculator functions, allowing malicious JavaScript to be injected through a crafted PDF file. This JavaScript can then be run with the permissions of the PDF viewer by its worker. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.8, Firefox < 60 and PDF.js < 2.0.550.

2 repos

https://github.com/puzzle-tools/-CVE-2018-5158.pdf

https://github.com/ppcrab/CVE-2018-5158

WPalant@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T13:21:30.000Z ##

@screaminggoat Oh, just great… I noted the dangerous glyph handling in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1452075 a.k.a. CVE-2018-5158 six years ago. Not immediately obvious whether the checks added to compileGlyph back then were insufficient or degraded over time due to refactoring. 🙄

##

CVE-2024-4985(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-28T18:41:40

9 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability was present in the GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) when utilizing SAML single sign-on authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature. This vulnerability allowed an attacker to forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with site administrator privileges. Exploitation of this vulnerability would allow unauthorized access to

patchnow24x7 at 2024-05-24T04:30:50.105Z ##

Critical: CVSS 10
Upgrade your GitHub Enterprise Server Right NOW, to mitigate CVE-2024-4985

PoC:
https://github.com/absholi7ly/Bypass-authentication-GitHub-Enterprise-Server

Advisory:
https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-server@3.10/admin/release-notes#3.10.12

https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-server@3.11/admin/release-notes#3.11.10

https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-server@3.12/admin/release-notes#3.12.4

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T15:12:44.000Z ##

GitHub security advisory: Enterprise Server 3.9.15
CVE-2024-4985 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) On instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: GitHub warns of SAML auth bypass flaw in Enterprise Server

#CVE_2024_4985 #vulnerability #GitHub #CVE #SAML

##

CVE-2024-4671
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-05-24T19:21:23

2 posts

Use after free in Visuals in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.201 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T19:17:23.000Z ##

Zero Day Engineering: Google Chrome "actively exploited" bug chain on Viz & v8-wasm (May 2024)
Alisa Esage provides root cause analyses for both CVE-2024-4671 (Use after free in Visuals, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to CISA KEV on 13 May) and CVE-2024-4761 (Out of bounds write in V8 allowing for RCE, disclosed 13 May 2024, added to KEV on 16 May). These were both exploited zero-days at the time of their disclosure.

h/t: @gnyman

#CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2024_4761 #Chrome #Google #zeroday #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-5273
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-24T18:52:11

2 posts

Jenkins Report Info Plugin 1.2 and earlier does not perform path validation of the workspace directory while serving report files. Additionally, Report Info Plugin does not support distributed builds. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to retrieve Surefire failures, PMD violations, Findbugs bugs, and Checkstyle errors on the controll

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:12:26.375Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-05-24
No mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others
  • Missing permission checks in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

#Jenkins #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T15:12:26.000Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-05-24
No mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others
  • Missing permission checks in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

##

CVE-2020-17519
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.15%

updated 2024-05-24T13:56:29

6 posts

A change introduced in Apache Flink 1.11.0 (and released in 1.11.1 and 1.11.2 as well) allows attackers to read any file on the local filesystem of the JobManager through the REST interface of the JobManager process. Access is restricted to files accessible by the JobManager process. All users should upgrade to Flink 1.11.3 or 1.12.0 if their Flink instance(s) are exposed. The issue was fixed in c

Nuclei template

11 repos

https://github.com/QmF0c3UK/CVE-2020-17519

https://github.com/dolevf/apache-flink-directory-traversal.nse

https://github.com/hoanx4/CVE-2020-17519

https://github.com/Osyanina/westone-CVE-2020-17519-scanner

https://github.com/MrCl0wnLab/SimplesApachePathTraversal

https://github.com/radbsie/CVE-2020-17519-Exp

https://github.com/zhangweijie11/CVE-2020-17519

https://github.com/yaunsky/CVE-2020-17519-Apache-Flink

https://github.com/murataydemir/CVE-2020-17519

https://github.com/givemefivw/CVE-2020-17519

https://github.com/B1anda0/CVE-2020-17519

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T12:40:33.171Z ##

@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

##
AAKL at 2024-05-23T15:15:21.551Z ##

New on #CISA. Apache Flink Improper Access Control Vulnerability Added to KEV Catalogue. #cybersecurity #infosec

- Apache Flink Improper Access Control Vulnerability - CVE-2020-17519: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-17519

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T14:31:44.477Z ##

EPSS: 96.31%

updated 2024-05-23T19:54:02.490000

3 posts

NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect before version 4.4.1 is vulnerable to unauthenticated remote code execution. Note that this vulnerability is caused by the incomplete patch of CVE-2023-37679.

Horizon3 had made it easy for the attacker by providing the proof of concept on 12 January 2024: https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/attack-blogs/writeup-for-cve-2023-43208-nextgen-mirth-connect-pre-auth-rce/

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T16:33:04.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

#CVE_2024_4947 #CVE_2023_43208 #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #Chrome #Mirth #NextGen #MirthConnect

Breșa de securitate (identificată ca CVE-2024-4835) este o problemă de XSS în editorul de cod VS (Web IDE) care permite persoanelor periculoase să fure […]

CVE-2024-4978
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.83%

updated 2024-05-23T03:30:42

10 posts

Justice AV Solutions Viewer Setup 8.3.7.250-1 contains a malicious binary when executed and is signed with an unexpected authenticode signature. A remote, privileged threat actor may exploit this vulnerability to execute of unauthorized PowerShell commands.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T15:18:31.380Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds the Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) backdoor CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. See parent toot above for more information. h/t: @jgreig

#CVE_2024_4978 #backdoor #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #trojan #gatedoor #rustdoor #vulnerability #JusticeAV #threatintel #IOC #kev #CISA #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T13:36:52.078Z ##

Rapid7:CVE-2024-4978: Backdoored Justice AV Solutions Viewer Software Used in Apparent Supply Chain Attack
WAKE UP, NEW BACKDOOR! Rapid7 reports that an installation file of Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) has been backdoored, which delivers GateDoor/Rustdoor malware. JAVS Suite 8 is a portfolio of audio/video recording, viewing, and management software for government organizations and businesses. This is being tracked as CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv4 8.7 high, CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7). They described observed attacker behavior, an exploitation timeline, and IOC.

fffmpeg.exe persistently communicates with a C2 server using Windows sockets and WinHTTP requests ... Malicious PowerShell scripts will attempt to bypass the Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and disable Event Tracing for Windows (ETW).

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @todb @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_4978 #backdoor #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #trojan #gatedoor #rustdoor #vulnerability #JusticeAV #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T15:18:31.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds the Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) backdoor CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. See parent toot above for more information. h/t: @jgreig

#CVE_2024_4978 #backdoor #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #trojan #gatedoor #rustdoor #vulnerability #JusticeAV #threatintel #IOC #kev #CISA #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

WAKE UP, NEW BACKDOOR! Rapid7 reports that an installation file of Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) has been backdoored, which delivers GateDoor/Rustdoor malware. JAVS Suite 8 is a portfolio of audio/video recording, viewing, and management software for government organizations and businesses. This is being tracked as CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv4 8.7 high, CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7). They described observed attacker behavior, an exploitation timeline, and IOC.

fffmpeg.exe persistently communicates with a C2 server using Windows sockets and WinHTTP requests ... Malicious PowerShell scripts will attempt to bypass the Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and disable Event Tracing for Windows (ETW).

##
AAKL at 2024-05-29T15:13:52.923Z ##

Looks like #CISA is in the process of updating the CVE-2024-4978 KEV catalogue listing. This refers to the Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) Viewer installer. #cybersecurity #infosec

##
rogeragrimes at 2024-05-28T15:38:16.761Z ##

Popular courtroom recording software was infected with a backdoor trojan malware program for months. Many courts and court cases likely impacted. I'm a little surprised this isn't getting more press.

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack

##
catc0n at 2024-05-23T14:45:52.957Z ##

In the course of investigating suspicious behavior in an MDR customer environment, Rapid7 discovered an apparent supply chain attack in the form of a backdoored installer being hosted on a legitimate vendor’s website. The vendor, Justice AV Solutions, makes AV software used in (among other things) courtrooms, prisons, and interrogations. Rapid7 MDR has observed C2 callbacks and other post-exploitation behavior related to the backdoored software in multiple customer environments.

Huge shout-out to all the MDR, IR, and vuln research folks who worked to validate and document findings, notify affected MDR customers, and investigate related activity. And an equally huge shout-out to @cisagov for their prompt assistance with disclosure.

The backdoored software was assigned CVE-2024-4978. Full write-up with attacker behavior observations, IOCs, guidance, and vendor statement here: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack/

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T15:13:52.000Z ##

Looks like #CISA is in the process of updating the CVE-2024-4978 KEV catalogue listing. This refers to the Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) Viewer installer. #cybersecurity #infosec

catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T14:45:52.000Z ##

In the course of investigating suspicious behavior in an MDR customer environment, Rapid7 discovered an apparent supply chain attack in the form of a backdoored installer being hosted on a legitimate vendor’s website. The vendor, Justice AV Solutions, makes AV software used in (among other things) courtrooms, prisons, and interrogations. Rapid7 MDR has observed C2 callbacks and other post-exploitation behavior related to the backdoored software in multiple customer environments.

Huge shout-out to all the MDR, IR, and vuln research folks who worked to validate and document findings, notify affected MDR customers, and investigate related activity. And an equally huge shout-out to @cisagov for their prompt assistance with disclosure.

The backdoored software was assigned CVE-2024-4978. Full write-up with attacker behavior observations, IOCs, guidance, and vendor statement here: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack/

CVE-2024-20293
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:59:20.240000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the activation of an access control list (ACL) on Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the protection that is offered by a configured ACL on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to a logic error that occurs when an ACL changes from inactive to active i

##

CVE-2024-20363
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:59:20.240000

2 posts

Multiple Cisco products are affected by a vulnerability in the Snort Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) rule engine that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the configured rules on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to incorrect HTTP packet handling. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets through an affected device. A successful

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T16:12:48.229Z ##

Cisco security advisories. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-20293 (5.8 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Inactive-to-Active ACL Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20363 (5.8 medium) Multiple Cisco Products Snort 3 HTTP Intrusion Prevention System Rule Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20261 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Encrypted Archive File Policy Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20239 (8.8 high) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software SQL Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20361 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software Object Group Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20355 (5.0 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-20355
(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:51

2 posts

A vulnerability in the implementation of SAML 2.0 single sign-on (SSO) for remote access VPN services in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to successfully establish a VPN session on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper separation of authorization domains when using SA

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T16:12:48.229Z ##

Cisco security advisories. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-20293 (5.8 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Inactive-to-Active ACL Bypass Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-5159(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:50

5 posts

Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##
topher@infosec.space at 2024-05-22T17:10:36.000Z ##

Let's see if #LinuxMint bothers with this one...

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-5159

(considering they didn't with the previous two high severity patches)

#chromium

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T20:53:11.263Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google ain't catchin me sleepin. They have another patch for 6 vulnerabilities, 4 externally reported, all high severity. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.

#Google #PatchTuesday #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

4 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:42

4 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

##

CVE-2024-36077
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:42

2 posts

Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before 14.187.4 allows a remote attacker to elevate their privilege due to improper validation. The attacker can elevate their privilege to the internal system role, which allows them to execute commands on the server. This affects February 2024 Patch 3 (14.173.3 through 14.173.7), November 2023 Patch 8 (14.159.4 through 14.159.13), August 2023 Patch 13 (14.139.3

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T19:24:49.515Z ##

Qlik security advisory: High Severity Security fixes for Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows (CVE-2024-36077)
CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

#Qlik #vulnerability #CVE_2024_36077 #QlikSense #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T19:24:49.000Z ##

Qlik security advisory: High Severity Security fixes for Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows (CVE-2024-36077)
CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

#Qlik #vulnerability #CVE_2024_36077 #QlikSense #CVE

(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T12:46:53.887000

2 posts

The vCenter Server contains a partial file read vulnerability. A malicious actor with administrative privileges on the vCenter appliance shell may exploit this issue to partially read arbitrary files containing sensitive data.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:53:33.066Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0011:VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities
VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22273, CVE-2024-22274, CVE-2024-22275) No mention of exploitation. h/t: @jgreig

  • CVE-2024-22273 (8.1 high) out-of-bounds read/write
  • CVE-2024-22274 (7.2 high) VMware vCenter Server authenticated remote-code execution
  • CVE-2024-22275 (4.9 medium) VMware vCenter Server partial file read

CVE-2024-21683(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-22T00:30:39

7 posts

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability was introduced in version 5.2 of Confluence Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 8.3, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to availability, and requires no user interaction.  Atla

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T20:12:39.143Z ##

Proof of concept released for CVE-2024-21683 (8.3 high) for a remote code execution in Atlassian Confluence:

  • Patch diffing: https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated
  • Proof of Concept and Weaponized exploit: https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-21683-RCE
##
psytester at 2024-05-24T14:26:53.605Z ##

@heisec
Falsche Zusammenfassung der aktuellen Lücken

Die CVE-2024-21683 mit seiner RCE ist wohl nicht schlimm genug um kritisch zu sein?
Ok, es ist der Admin Endpoint in der App Verwaltung betroffen
/admin/plugins/........
aber die Ausnutzung ist dann sehr simpel.

##
psytester at 2024-05-22T21:42:45.524Z ##

CVE-2024-21683 Atlassian Confluence RCE exploit is already out.
Credit goes to Huong Kieu
https://twitter.com/realalphaman_
and his writeup https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated

Fortunately, this is an admin endpoint
/admin/plugins/newcode/addlanguage.action
but payload is really very simple as javascript file content.

CVE-2024-22273
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:32

2 posts

The storage controllers on VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion have out-of-bounds read/write vulnerability. A malicious actor with access to a virtual machine with storage controllers enabled may exploit this issue to create a denial of service condition or execute code on the hypervisor from a virtual machine in conjunction with other issues.

CVE-2024-27130
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:32

3 posts

A buffer copy without checking size of input vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow users to execute code via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following version: QTS 5.1.7.2770 build 20240520 and later QuTS hero h5.1.7.2770 build 20240520 and later

2 repos

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-27130

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/CVE-2024-27130

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T12:58:54.000Z ##

QNAP security advisory: Vulnerabilities in QTS and QuTS hero
Following the public disclosure by watchTowr (see parent toot above), QNAP patches five of the vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-21902: Missing authentication could allow authenticated users to read or modify the resource
  • CVE-2024-27127: double free vulnerability allows for RCE
  • CVE-2024-27128, CVE-2024-27129, CVE-2024-27130: buffer overflow to RCE

No CVSS scores at this time, no mention of exploitation. h/t @campuscodi

#vulnerability #watchtowr #QNAP #CVE_2024_21902 #CVE_2024_27127 #CVE_2024_27128 #CVE_2024_27129 #CVE_2024_27130

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T12:29:56.000Z ##

Last week, watchTowr Labs published a report about 15 vulnerabilities in QNAP NAS devices: https://labs.watchtowr.com/qnap-qts-qnapping-at-the-wheel-cve-2024-27130-and-friends/

QNAP patched only four.

Days after a PoC was published online, QNAP patched another five

https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-24-23

CVE-2024-29000 (7.9 high) The SolarWinds Platform was determined to be affected by a reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability affecting the web console. A high-privileged user and user interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability. No mention of exploitation.
Note: Not sure why SolarWinds is saying "first published 18 April 2024" since CVE and NVD are showing 20 May 2024.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T19:17:23.000Z ##

Zero Day Engineering: Google Chrome "actively exploited" bug chain on Viz & v8-wasm (May 2024)
Alisa Esage provides root cause analyses for both CVE-2024-4671 (Use after free in Visuals, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to CISA KEV on 13 May) and CVE-2024-4761 (Out of bounds write in V8 allowing for RCE, disclosed 13 May 2024, added to KEV on 16 May). These were both exploited zero-days at the time of their disclosure.

h/t: @gnyman

#CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2024_4761 #Chrome #Google #zeroday #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-4323
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-20T12:30:36

19 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability in Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 thru 3.0.3. This issue lies in the embedded http server’s parsing of trace requests and may result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

3 repos

https://github.com/skilfoy/CVE-2024-4323-Exploit-POC

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-4323

https://github.com/yuansec/CVE-2024-4323-dos_poc

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.901Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

Lapizistik@social.tchncs.de at 2024-05-23T18:50:11.000Z ##

##
ariadne@treehouse.systems at 2024-05-21T19:32:47.000Z ##

well, i see fluent-bit folks are adding defensive programming stuff to "fix" CVE-2024-4323, sigh

the correct fix for that CVE is to adjust flb_sds_create_len() and related functions to take size_t for object sizes

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

##
ariadne@treehouse.systems at 2024-05-21T19:32:47.000Z ##

well, i see fluent-bit folks are adding defensive programming stuff to "fix" CVE-2024-4323, sigh

the correct fix for that CVE is to adjust flb_sds_create_len() and related functions to take size_t for object sizes

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-21T12:05:06.000Z ##

Critical Fluent Bit flaw affects major cloud platforms, tech companies’ offerings (CVE-2024-4323) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/21/cve-2024-4323/ #cloudcomputing #vulnerability #GoogleCloud #opensource #TrendMicro #Don'tmiss #SumoLogic #Hotstuff #logging #Tenable #VMware #Cisco #Intel #News #AWS

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T10:18:35.000Z ##

Tenable security researchers have found a vulnerability in the Fluent Bit monitoring and logging utility.

Named Linguistic Lumberjack (CVE-2024-4323), the vulnerability can be used for denial of service, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

A fix was committed to the Fluent Bit code last week, but the project has not released an official fix/

Tenable fears threat actors may exploit knowledge of the bug to launch attacks.

https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-432

##
acdha@code4lib.social at 2024-05-21T01:33:31.000Z ##

Another entry in the “even high-profile teams struggle to use C safely” file:
https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-4323

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T19:28:28.000Z ##

Tenable: Linguistic Lumberjack: Attacking Cloud Services via Logging Endpoints (Fluent Bit - CVE-2024-4323)
Tenable provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4323 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Tenable). Fluent Bit is a logging utility heavily used by all major cloud providers. This memory corruption vulnerability (dubbed Linguistic Lumberjack cc: @shellsharks) could result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

h/t: @jgreig

#CVE_2024_4323 #LinguisticLumberjack #Fluent #vulnerability #CVE

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T17:53:43.000Z ##

Tenable: Linguistic Lumberjack: Attacking Cloud Services via Logging Endpoints (Fluent Bit - CVE-2024-4323) https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-4323 @tenablesecurity #cybersecurity #infosec

via @SecurityWeek https://www.securityweek.com/vulnerability-found-in-fluent-bit-utility-used-by-major-cloud-tech-companies/ @ekovacs

CVE-2024-4956
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.27%

updated 2024-05-17T18:36:31.297000

6 posts

Path Traversal in Sonatype Nexus Repository 3 allows an unauthenticated attacker to read system files. Fixed in version 3.68.1.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:24:02.034Z ##

SOCRadar: PoC Exploit for CVE-2024-4956 in Sonatype Nexus Repository 3 Draws Threat Actors’ Attention
SOCRadar warns of cybercriminal interest in CVE-2024-4956, (7.5 high, disclosed 16 May 2024 by Sonatype) a path traversal vulnerability (cc: @reverseics) in Sonatype Nexus Repository 3 allowing for file read. Proof of concept is available.

#CVE_2024_4956 #cve #vulnerability #proofofconcept

##

CVE-2024-30043
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:05

6 posts

Microsoft SharePoint Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T18:54:38.201Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-30043: Abusing Url Parsing Confusion To Exploit XXE On Sharepoint Server And Cloud
Piotr Bazydło covers CVE-2024-30043 (6.5 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft SharePoint Server information disclosure vulnerability, referred to as an XML eXternal Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." The impact of CVE-2024-30043 allows for file read with SharePoint Farm Service account permission, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks, NTLM relay attacks, and other XXE side effects.

This blog includes such gems like "Who cares anyway? YOLO and let’s move along with the exploitation." Piotr provides a detailed walkthrough leading to the exploitation, along with a Proof of Concept.

#CVE_2024_30043 #XXE #SharePoint #vulnerability #CVE #rootcauseanalysis #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T18:54:38.000Z ##

His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." The impact of CVE-2024-30043 allows for file read with SharePoint Farm Service account permission, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks, NTLM relay attacks, and other XXE side effects.

Piotr Bazydło covers CVE-2024-30043 (6.5 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft SharePoint Server information disclosure vulnerability, referred to as an XML eXternal Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." CVE-2024-22267
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-05-14T18:30:59

1 posts

VMware Workstation and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the vbluetooth device. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-05-24T09:27:32.036Z ##

Upgrade your VMWare Workstation and Fusion to mitigate CVE-2024-22267..

An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. Lack of certificate validation on HTTP communications allows attackers to intercept and tamper data. This affects Nuki Smart Lock 3.0 before 3.3.5, Nuki Bridge v1 before 1.22.0 and Nuki Bridge v2 before 2.13.2.

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-14T18:30:48

2 posts

An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. The code used to parse the JSON objects received from the WebSocket service provided by the device leads to a stack buffer overflow. An attacker would be able to exploit this to gain arbitrary code execution on a KeyTurner device. This affects Nuki Smart Lock 3.0 before 3.3.5 and 2.0 before 2.12.4, as well as Nuki Bridge v1 before 1.2

CVE-2022-32510(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-14T18:30:45

2 posts

An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. The HTTP API exposed by a Bridge used an unencrypted channel to provide an administrative interface. A token can be easily eavesdropped by a malicious actor to impersonate a legitimate user and gain access to the full set of API endpoints. This affects Nuki Bridge v1 before 1.22.0 and v2 before 2.13.2.

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-14T18:30:45

2 posts

An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. An attacker with physical access to this JTAG port may be able to connect to the device and bypass both hardware and software security protections. This affects Nuki Keypad before 1.9.2 and Nuki Fob before 1.8.1.

##

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-05-14T17:57:02

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

Nuclei template

CVE-2024-34359
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:12:23.490000

5 posts

llama-cpp-python is the Python bindings for llama.cpp. `llama-cpp-python` depends on class `Llama` in `llama.py` to load `.gguf` llama.cpp or Latency Machine Learning Models. The `__init__` constructor built in the `Llama` takes several parameters to configure the loading and running of the model. Other than `NUMA, LoRa settings`, `loading tokenizers,` and `hardware settings`, `__init__` also load

shellsharks@shellsharks.social at 2024-05-22T15:38:22.000Z ##

Reporting from SecurityWeek on a new “Critical" vulnerability affecting Jinja2 & llama_cpp_python, dubbed “Llama Drama” https://www.securityweek.com/critical-flaw-in-ai-python-package-can-lead-to-system-and-data-compromise/

Info and PoC video here: https://github.com/abetlen/llama-cpp-python/security/advisories/GHSA-56xg-wfcc-g829

Checkmarx has an official page for the vuln but the author appears to have oopsied the actual blog content putting something else completely different in there… https://checkmarx.com/blog/llama-drama-critical-vulnerability-cve-2024-34359-threatening-your-software-supply-chain/

#cve202434359 #llamadrama #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-27842(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:12

4 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

decio at 2024-05-30T08:46:12.543Z ##

Une vulnérabilité dans macOS Sonoma (CVE-2024-27842) permet une élévation de privilèges via le système de fichiers UDF et les fonctions IOCTL, exécutant du code avec des privilèges kernel. Le PoC a été publié.

Apple a corrigé cette faille dans macOS 14.5
👇
https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214106

PoC
⬇️ :twitter: 🔗
https://x.com/WangTielei/status/1793809920850370905
👇
https://github.com/wangtielei/POCs/blob/main/CVE-2024-27842/poc.m

CVE-2024-29212
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:09

2 posts

Due to an unsafe de-serialization method used by the Veeam Service Provider Console(VSPC) server in communication between the management agent and its components, under certain conditions, it is possible to perform Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the VSPC server machine.

zeljkazorz at 2024-05-28T18:05:02.904Z ##

Veeam has issued an “enhanced update” to address CVE-2024-29212, an RCE flaw in its Service Provider Console (VSPC).

Sounds like an incomplete first patch:

“Although our initial patch, issued on May 7th, effectively addressed the primary concern, a subsequent review identified an area for further improvement. To ensure comprehensive protection, we swiftly developed and released a refined patch that fully mitigates the issue.”

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/08/cve-2024-29212/

#Veeam #Backup #CVE #Cybersecurity

CVE-2024-34342
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-08T10:10:23

4 posts

### Summary If PDF.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with `isEvalSupported` set to `true` (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain. ### Patches [This patch](https://github.com/wojtekmaj/react-pdf/commit/671e6eaa2e373e404040c13cc6b668fe39839cad) forces `isEvalSupported` to `false`, re

1 repos

https://github.com/LOURC0D3/CVE-2024-4367-PoC

DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-31T14:11:16.782Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-4367 & CVE-2024-34342: Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #Vulnerability

"A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with isEvalSupported set to true (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain."

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1796544839464452335

##
DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-22T14:58:12.409Z ##

##

CVE-2024-4367(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-07T10:26:15

16 posts

### Impact If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with `isEvalSupported` set to `true` (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain. ### Patches The patch removes the use of `eval`: https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/pull/18015 ### Workarounds Set the option `isEvalSupported` to `false`

5 repos

https://github.com/clarkio/pdfjs-vuln-demo

https://github.com/spaceraccoon/detect-cve-2024-4367

https://github.com/LOURC0D3/CVE-2024-4367-PoC

https://github.com/avalahEE/pdfjs_disable_eval

https://github.com/s4vvysec/CVE-2024-4367-POC

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #Vulnerability

"A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with isEvalSupported set to true (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain."

@campuscodi @wdormann pointed out that the popular note-taking app Obsidian is vulnerable to CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Mozilla, proof of concept available 20 May) This was addressed in Obsidian 1.6.1.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-23T14:55:52.000Z ##

Codean's Thomas Rinsma has published a write-up of a bug he found in Mozilla's PDF.js PDF file viewer.

The bug could have allowed threat actors to run malicious code inside apps where the PDF.js library was used and left misconfigured.

It's a pretty niche scenario, but 10/10 on the nasty scale.

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-4367-arbitrary-js-execution-in-pdf-js/

##
pkiff@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T14:24:54.000Z ##

Not surprised by the new security vulnerability in Mozilla's PDF.js - patched in latest Firefox. But remind me again why browsers try to render PDFs to begin with?

Displaying PDFs in browsers opens a huge new attack surface. PDFs are complex. Browsers render PDF forms poorly and offer only a limited subset of the many accessibility features provided by dedicated PDF software.

I wish none of the browser makers did this.

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-4367-arbitrary-js-execution-in-pdf-js/

#PDF #Mozilla #Firefox #Security #Accessibility

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T11:55:20.000Z ##

Codean Labs: CVE-2024-4367 – Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js
Codean Labs provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending). PDF.js is a JavaScript-based PDF viewer maintained by Mozilla. This bug allows an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code as soon as a malicious PDF file is opened. This affects all Firefox users (<126) because PDF.js is used by Firefox to show PDF files, but also seriously impacts many web- and Electron-based applications that (indirectly) use PDF.js for preview functionality.
Note: This vulnerability was included in the security advisories from 15 May 2024, see parent toot above.

#CVE_2024_4367 #Firefox #PDFjs #CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-04T03:30:45

15 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

4 repos

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/absolutedesignltd/iconvfix

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

swapgs at 2024-05-27T10:04:53.669Z ##

The great @cfreal just released a detailed write-up of his glibc bug that he could exploit in PHP thanks to the iconv filter (CVE-2024-2961). This changes everything on vulnerable versions of PHP—most file read primitives now lead to RCE.

https://www.ambionics.io/blog/iconv-cve-2024-2961-p1

##

CVE-2023-6961
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-02T18:00:37.360000

4 posts

The WP Meta SEO plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘Referer’ header in all versions up to, and including, 4.5.12 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-30T16:00:05.000Z ##

Critical WordPress Plugin Flaws Exploited to Inject Malicious Scripts and Backdoors https://www.securityweek.com/critical-wordpress-plugin-flaws-exploited-to-inject-malicious-scripts-and-backdoors/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202340000 #CVE20236961 #CVE20242194 #WordPress #Fastly

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-30T16:00:04.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 13.34%

updated 2024-05-01T19:15:27.340000

6 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked

Nuclei template

BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-05-30T16:47:01.000Z ##

#XZ 5.6.2 Released With The Frightening #Backdoor Removed
Lasse Collin released XZ 5.6.2 today with the CVE-2024-3094 backdoor cleared out that was present in the former v5.6 and v5.6.1 releases.
Lasse Collin also announced that Sam James has stepped up as a supporting maintainer moving forward for the XZ project.
The XZ 5.6.2 release also has a few bug fixes.
https://www.phoronix.com/news/XZ-5.6.2-Released

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.26%

updated 2024-05-01T18:31:14

16 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

4 repos

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/rootkalilocalhost/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.104Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T15:07:36.662Z ##

Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T15:07:36.000Z ##

Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

##
TomiMcCluskey at 2024-06-01T19:45:47.882Z ##

🔥 Notselwyn's latest blog post is a must-read for anyone interested in Linux kernel exploitation! 🐧

In "Flipping Pages," they dive deep into CVE-2024-1086, a double-free vulnerability in nf_tables, and demonstrates how to craft a powerful Linux Privilege Escalation exploit. 🚨

But this is more than just a PoC - it's a masterclass in vulnerability research! Notselwyn walks us through his entire process, from finding the bug to developing novel techniques.

Key highlights:

🔸 mitigations like KASLR, KPTI, SMAP, and SMEP
🔸 arbitrary R/W primitives from userland
🔸 exploitation for maximum stealth

Perhaps most impressive is the exploit's broad compatibility (thanks to data-only techniques) and rock-solid stability (93-99% success rate!). 💪

Whether you're a beginner looking to learn or a seasoned researcher seeking inspiration, this blogpost has something for you. It's clear that Notselwyn put a ton of effort into making this both educational and practical.

Grab a coffee ☕, settle in, and prepare to level up your Linux kernel exploitation skills! 🚀

At the time of writing, the stable branches linux-5.15.y, linux-6.1.y, and linux-6.6.y are affected by this exploit, and perhaps linux-6.7.1

https://pwning.tech/nftables/

#Infosec #LinuxKernel #Exploitation #VulnerabilityResearch

##

CVE-2024-1597
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:13.333000

2 posts

pgjdbc, the PostgreSQL JDBC Driver, allows attacker to inject SQL if using PreferQueryMode=SIMPLE. Note this is not the default. In the default mode there is no vulnerability. A placeholder for a numeric value must be immediately preceded by a minus. There must be a second placeholder for a string value after the first placeholder; both must be on the same line. By constructing a matching string p

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T15:50:48.206Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - May 21 2024
"The vulnerabilities reported in this Security Bulletin include 35 high-severity vulnerabilities and 2 critical-severity vulnerabilities which have been fixed in new versions of our products (Bamboo, Bitbucket, Confluence, Crowd, Jira, and Jira Service Management), released in the last month."
Note: CVE-2024-1597 (9.8 critical) SQL injection vulnerability affects both Confluence Data Center and Server, and Jira Data Center and Server. The CNA (PostGRE) also rated it as a perfect 10.0 🥳 cc: @cR0w
