CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.70%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:00.070000

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

xnyhps at 2024-05-23T08:52:43.412Z ##

Reporting issues in Windows. 🤡

* August, 25, 2023: Issue reported to MSRC.
…
* April 9, 2024: Fix released as CVE-2024-20693.
* April 25, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us.
* April 26, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team sends back a boilerplate reply that the case is under review.
* May 17, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us again.
* May 22, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team replies that the vulnerability is out of scope for a bounty, claiming it wasn’t reproduced on the right WIP build.

#Microsoft #MSRC

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T08:52:43.000Z ##

…

* April 26, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team sends back a boilerplate reply that the case is under review.
* May 17, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us again.
* May 22, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team replies that the vulnerability is out of scope for a bounty, claiming it wasn’t reproduced on the right WIP build.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:49:26.802Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:38:34.669Z ##

@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 33.85%

updated 2024-04-04T07:09:58

2 posts

RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to ac

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T19:12:41.700Z ##

Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. The campaign was detected on 18 April 2024 with several weeks of reconnaissance/weaponization activity before being successfully disrupted. Cloudflare provides provide recommendations, detections (including PowerShell, Microsoft Sentinel, and Splunk scripts), and indicators of compromise. Extremely impressive write-up.

#threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T19:12:41.000Z ##

Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. The campaign was detected on 18 April 2024 with several weeks of reconnaissance/weaponization activity before being successfully disrupted. Cloudflare provides provide recommendations, detections (including PowerShell, Microsoft Sentinel, and Splunk scripts), and indicators of compromise. Extremely impressive write-up.

#threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

##

CVE-2019-15901
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-04-04T02:31:21

2 posts

An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. A setusercontext(3) call with flags to change the UID, primary GID, and secondary GIDs was replaced (on certain platforms: Linux and possibly NetBSD) with a single setuid(2) call. This resulted in neither changing the group id nor initializing secondary group ids.

brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

##
brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

Use after free in WebCodecs in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

##

CVE-2024-2194
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-13T18:15:58.530000

4 posts

The WP Statistics plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the URL search parameter in all versions up to, and including, 14.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

CVE-2023-6246
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.77%

updated 2024-02-25T05:08:29

2 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalatio

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/elpe-pinillo/CVE-2023-6246

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T15:08:27.128Z ##

elpe_pinillo: HEAP HEAP HOORAY — Unveiling GLIBC heap overflow vulnerability (CVE-2023–6246)
elpe_pinillo provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2023–6246 (CNA 8.4 high, NVD 7.8, disclosed 29 January 2024 by Red Hat) heap-based buffer overflow in the glibc library. They describe heap overflows, "Heap Feng Shui" (a real memory exploitation technique), and arriving at an exploit for CVE-2023_6246. h/t: @0xor0ne

#CVE_2023_6246 #glibc #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2019-15900
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2024-02-16T18:31:02

2 posts

An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. On platforms without strtonum(3), sscanf was used without checking for error cases. Instead, the uninitialized variable errstr was checked and in some cases returned success even if sscanf failed. The result was that, instead of reporting that the supplied username or group name did not exist, it would exe

brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

CVE-2024-23108
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-02-07T15:02:00.203000

20 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

2 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-23108

https://github.com/hitem/CVE-2024-23108

deltatux@infosec.town at 2024-05-29T04:31:47.898Z ##

If you haven't patched your Fortinet FortiSIEM yet, you really should as the researchers who discovered CVE-2024-23108 (CVSS score of 10/10) has released the proof of concept exploit code into the wild.

Seriously, patch now!

www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-maximum-severity-fortinet-rce-bug-patch-now

#infosec #cybersecurity #fortinet #patchnow #CVE_2024_23108

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:49:26.802Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:31:21.502Z ##

#CVE_2024_23108 #Fortinet #FortiSIEM #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept

AAKL at 2024-05-28T17:02:31.715Z ##

Exploit released for maximum severity #Fortinet RCE bug - CVE-2024-23108 https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-maximum-severity-fortinet-rce-bug-patch-now/ @BleepingComputer @serghei #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:38:34.669Z ##

@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-05T15:30:29

5 posts

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:49:26.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:38:34.000Z ##

@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

CVE-2021-30860
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-02-02T03:08:54.213000

1 posts

An integer overflow was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in Security Update 2021-005 Catalina, iOS 14.8 and iPadOS 14.8, macOS Big Sur 11.6, watchOS 7.6.2. Processing a maliciously crafted PDF may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

3 repos

https://github.com/30440r/gex

https://github.com/jeffssh/CVE-2021-30860

koteisaev@mastodon.online at 2024-05-30T16:11:44.000Z ##

//The #Pegasus sent an iMessage to its targets that contained what appeared to be GIF images, but which in fact contained a JBIG2 image. A vulnerability in the Xpdf implementation of JBIG2, re-used in Apple's iOS phone operating software, allowed Pegasus to construct an emulated computer architecture inside the JBIG2 stream which was then used to implement the zero-click attack. Apple fixed the vulnerability in iOS 14.8 in September 2021 as CVE-2021-30860 //
👻 😱 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus_(spyware)

CVE-2023-46218
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-01-25T14:15:26.117000

2 posts

This flaw allows a malicious HTTP server to set "super cookies" in curl that are then passed back to more origins than what is otherwise allowed or possible. This allows a site to set cookies that then would get sent to different and unrelated sites and domains. It could do this by exploiting a mixed case flaw in curl's function that verifies a given cookie domain against the Public Suffix List (

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-05-30T07:13:14.000Z ##

#Windows users running stupid scanners now contact us for support regarding CVE-2023-46218 which the scanners say affects #curl 8.4.0 shipped by Microsoft.

It would, if their version was built to use #iibpsl, a prereq for this CVE, which #Microsoft does not.

Security scanners. A snake oil business.

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2023-46218.html

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.389Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.000Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

CVE-2020-17159
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.35%

updated 2024-01-07T05:05:37

2 posts

, aka 'Visual Studio Code Java Extension Pack Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T12:40:33.171Z ##

@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.389Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.000Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

EPSS: 97.52%

updated 2023-11-07T02:51:46.073000

2 posts

CVE-2023-1389
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.88%

updated 2023-08-11T15:30:44

2 posts

TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) firmware versions before 1.1.4 Build 20230219 contained a command injection vulnerability in the country form of the /cgi-bin/luci;stok=/locale endpoint on the web management interface. Specifically, the country parameter of the write operation was not sanitized before being used in a call to popen(), allowing an unauthenticated attacker to inject commands, which would

2 repos

https://github.com/Terminal1337/CVE-2023-1389

https://github.com/Voyag3r-Security/CVE-2023-1389

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

CVE-2023-28450
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2023-04-17T03:30:19

3 posts

An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.

ondrej@sury.org at 2024-05-27T14:39:34.000Z ##

@bortzmeyer This is absolutely absurd, the security should not be a Pokémon:

Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
Knot: CVE-2023-49206
Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
Technitium: CVE-2023-28456 CVE-2023-49203
MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
Dnsmasq: CVE-2023-28450 CVE-2023-49207
CoreDNS: CVE-2023-28454 CVE-2023-49202
SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T14:49:25.353Z ##

Sysdig: DDoS-as-a-Service: The Rebirth Botnet
Sysdig reports a DDoS-as-a-Service Mirai-based botnet using the domain rebirthltd[.]com to launch attacks. One of the vulnerabilities targeted is a Ruckus AP remote code execution/cross-site request forgery vulnerability CVE-2023-25717 (9.8 critical, disclosed 08 February 2023 by Ruckus, has proof of concept, added to CISA KEV Catalog on 12 May 2023).Sysdig describes motivations, attribution, campaigns, infection methods, and detection methods. IOC not really included.

CVE-2018-20062
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.68%

updated 2023-02-01T05:07:52

4 posts

An issue was discovered in NoneCms V1.3. thinkphp/library/think/App.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via crafted use of the filter parameter, as demonstrated by the s=index/\think\Request/input&filter=phpinfo&data=1 query string.

2 repos

https://github.com/NS-Sp4ce/thinkphp5.XRce

https://github.com/yilin1203/CVE-2018-20062

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##

CVE-2019-0604
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.40%

updated 2023-02-01T05:07:51

2 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft SharePoint when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package, aka 'Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-0594.

8 repos

https://github.com/davidlebr1/cve-2019-0604-SP2010-netv3.5

https://github.com/linhlhq/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/k8gege/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/MayankPandey01/Sparty-2.0

https://github.com/boxhg/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/likescam/CVE-2019-0604_sharepoint_CVE

https://github.com/Gh0st0ne/weaponized-0604

https://github.com/m5050/CVE-2019-0604

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T01:03:21.000Z ##

@campuscodi I think it's important to note that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) was known to target CVE-2019-0604, a SharePoint (Server) RCE vulnerability in attacks on both Albania and Israel. If we were to build an APT threat actor profile, we can list this CVE as their preferred Exploit Public Facing Application of choice.

The language Check Point Research used implied that Scarred Manticore will pass off the final actions on objective (wiper/encryption/data destruction) to Void Manticore (aka Storm-0842) as the "closer."

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T11:58:51.000Z ##

Check Point Research: Bad Karma, No Justice: Void Manticore Destructive Activities In Israel
Check Point Research reports on the Iranian threat actor “Void Manticore” (aka Storm-0842) who they state is affiliated with the Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS). Void Manticore operates several online personas, from Homeland Justice for attacks in Albania, and Karma for attacks carried out in Israel. Void Manticore utilizes five different methods to conduct disruptive operations against its victims. This includes several custom wipers for both Windows and Linux, alongside manual deletion of files and shared drives. Void Manticore and Scarred Manticore have target overlaps and there are indications of systematic hand off of targets between those two groups (Void handles the rest). IOC and Yara rules provided.

Check Point offhandedly mentioned that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) exploits CVE-2019-0604 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 February 2019 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution for initial access.

#VoidManticore #cyberespionage #Iran #threatintel #Storm0842 #Oilrig #APT34 #IOC #Yara #CVE_2019_0604

CVE-2022-26134
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.51%

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:24

2 posts

In affected versions of Confluence Server and Data Center, an OGNL injection vulnerability exists that would allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on a Confluence Server or Data Center instance. The affected versions are from 1.3.0 before 7.4.17, from 7.13.0 before 7.13.7, from 7.14.0 before 7.14.3, from 7.15.0 before 7.15.2, from 7.16.0 before 7.16.4, from 7.17.0 before 7.17

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

CVE-2022-22954
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.42%

updated 2023-01-27T05:01:41

4 posts

VMware Workspace ONE Access and Identity Manager contain a remote code execution vulnerability due to server-side template injection. A malicious actor with network access can trigger a server-side template injection that may result in remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unaut

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.566Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

https://github.com/smackerdodi/CVE-2024-24919-nuclei-templater

https://github.com/zam89/CVE-2024-24919

https://github.com/eoslvs/CVE-2024-24919

https://github.com/LucasKatashi/CVE-2024-24919

https://github.com/c3rrberu5/CVE-2024-24919

https://github.com/hendprw/CVE-2024-24919

jamesatack at 2024-05-31T13:48:58.928Z ##

@onyphe has found 30,030 vulnerable #Checkpoint devices out of a total of 59,283 tested. #CVE202424919 could be a mess

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##
cyberlibrarian at 2024-05-31T14:29:52.604Z ##

If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T13:01:01.540Z ##

Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T20:42:43.560Z ##

Rapid: CVE-2024-24919: Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure
Rapid7 warns of CVE-2024-24919 information disclosure vulnerability affecting Check Point Security Gateway. They describe the Check Point security advisory, Mnemonic threat advisory (contains IOC), watchTowr's vulnerability analysis, and that CVE-2024-24919 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog. All of these are linked in the parent toots above. Rapid7 points out what successful web administration panel and SSH logins would appear as in log events. Curiously, they forgot to mention the identified IPs from mnemonic's blog.

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.104Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T03:02:05.144Z ##

watchTowr: Check Point - Wrong Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)
This is beyond words. watchTowr patch diffed CVE-2024-24919 and confirmed that this is a path traversal (cc: @reverseics) leading to arbitrary file read. This is much more severe and deserves a critical CVSSv3 score. cc: @wdormann

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.170Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T16:01:38.064Z ##

mnemonic: Advisory: Active exploitation of Check Point Remote Access VPN vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919)
mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T12:19:53.711Z ##

Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

View the following fix: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

h/t to @serghei and @BleepingComputer for their initial news article. cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @dangoodin

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.000Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##
cyberlibrarian@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T14:29:52.000Z ##

If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T13:01:01.000Z ##

Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel

mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T12:19:53.000Z ##

Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

View the following fix: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

h/t to @serghei and @BleepingComputer for their initial news article. cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @dangoodin

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
DarkWebInformer at 2024-06-01T17:36:43.573Z ##

⚠️CVE-2024-24919⚠️Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure.

https://github.com/ifconfig-me/CVE-2024-24919-Bulk-Scanner

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec

More: This Python script scans lisy of URLs for CVE-2024-24919 vulnerability by sending specific POST requests and checking the response headers and status code. It logs the request and response details and identifies vulnerable URLs based on predefined criteria.

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1796954051743023243

##
pnokel@chaos.social at 2024-05-31T21:08:26.000Z ##

@flo Das war auf heute Vormittag bezogen. Manche Sachen kann man sich nicht ausdenken: https://labs.watchtowr.com/check-point-wrong-check-point-cve-2024-24919/

##
pentesttools at 2024-05-31T13:18:49.309Z ##

🚨 Got an important heads-up for you: CVE-2024-24919 - the Check Point VPN path-traversal vulnerability - is a zero-day you need to be on top of. 👉 Here are 3 reasons why:

⚠️ It’s ridiculously easy to exploit because it's remote, unauthenticated, and many VPN servers are exposed on the Internet.
⚠️ The proof of concept (PoC) is already out there and it's already spread like wildfire.
⚠️ This vulnerability lets attackers read *any file* on the compromised server.

🎯 But here’s the good news: we've just integrated detection for this CVE in our Network Vulnerability Scanner! ➡️ https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/network-security-scanner-online

Take a moment to scan your servers and see if you need to deploy any updates before the weekend.

Here are the details from our vuln & exploits DB: https://pentest-tools.com/vulnerabilities-exploits/check-point-quantum-gateway-information-disclosure_22692

#penetrationtesting #ethicalhacking #cybersecurity

##
decio at 2024-05-30T10:28:48.178Z ##

LOL l'état de ces appliances de sécurité en frontière 😅 (des pauvres petits Linux :linux: figés et « protégés » par obscurité) est telle que les fournisseurs arrivent à ce genre de gemmes en conseil de mitigation 🤦‍♂️

Pour empêcher toute tentative d'exploitation de cette vulnérabilité, vous devez protéger la passerelle derrière une passerelle. 🆗 not 🆗

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-30T00:23:43.000Z ##

Check Point has released a security update to patch a zero-day exploited in its VPN and security appliances.

Tracked as CVE-2024-24919, the zero-day is an information disclosure that allows threat actor to retrieve data from appliances.

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

Security firm Mnemonic says it observed threat actors use the vulnerability to enumerate and extract password hashes, including the accounts used to connect to Active Directory.

https://www.mnemonic.io/resources/blog/advisory-check-point-remote-access-vpn-vulnerability-cve-2024-24919/

##
euroinfosec at 2024-05-29T10:53:55.888Z ##

Patch alert: Check Point issues "mandatory" security update for its security gateways to fix a vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919) being exploited in the wild, and which poses a risk when security gateways have Remote Access VPN or the Mobile Access blade enabled.
https://www.databreachtoday.com/check-point-issues-emergency-patch-for-security-gateways-a-25334

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-26T05:08:16.284Z ##

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

##
pentesttools@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T13:18:49.000Z ##

🚨 Got an important heads-up for you: CVE-2024-24919 - the Check Point VPN path-traversal vulnerability - is a zero-day you need to be on top of. 👉 Here are 3 reasons why:

⚠️ It’s ridiculously easy to exploit because it's remote, unauthenticated, and many VPN servers are exposed on the Internet.
⚠️ The proof of concept (PoC) is already out there and it's already spread like wildfire.
⚠️ This vulnerability lets attackers read *any file* on the compromised server.

🎯 But here’s the good news: we've just integrated detection for this CVE in our Network Vulnerability Scanner! ➡️ https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/network-security-scanner-online

Take a moment to scan your servers and see if you need to deploy any updates before the weekend.

Here are the details from our vuln & exploits DB: https://pentest-tools.com/vulnerabilities-exploits/check-point-quantum-gateway-information-disclosure_22692

screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:41:33.509Z ##

Citrix security advisory: Citrix Workspace app for Mac Security Bulletin for CVE-2024-5027
CVE-2024-5027 (7.7 high) Elevation of privilege from a local authenticated user to a root user (IF they have local authenticated user access to the device where Citrix Workspace App for Mac is installed). No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_5027 #Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-34161
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.124Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.000Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.
